meanings.definition: A person who praises or extols someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The laudators cheered loudly for the talented singer.
meanings.sent2: The laudators at the event applauded the award winners.
meanings.sent3: The laudators jokingly claimed they needed earplugs from all the clapping.
meanings.sent4: Her parents were the laudators of her achievements, shining like proud stars.
meanings.sent5: The laudators' voices filled the room with admiration and respect.

meanings.definition: Those who give praise or commendation.
meanings.sent1: We thanked the laudators for their kind words about our project.
meanings.sent2: The laudators in the audience praised the author for his inspiring speech.
meanings.sent3: The laudators playfully competed to see who could give the most compliments.
meanings.sent4: Their teacher was always surrounded by a group of laudators after class.
meanings.sent5: The laudators' positive feedback motivated the team to work even harder.
